subtasks: Obtain seed per pound rate information
Determine the desired number of seeds per acre
Calculate pounds per acre needed to achieve desired seeding rate
Use calibration worksheet to derive seed catch amount
Prepare necessary tools (tape measure, ruler, calculator, duct tape, scale, cups)
Set grain drill to starting point (e.g., transmission in lowest setting, correct gauge wheel notch)
Collect seed samples from specified number of row units (e.g., five for a Great Plains drill)
Empty seed cups, prime drill with seed, and turn gauge wheel a specified number of revolutions (e.g., 15 turns)
Zero out scale and weigh collected seed
Adjust seed distributor cog position using ruler for precise measurement
Repeat calibration process on other side of drill if necessary
Mark calibration settings with magnets or similar devices
Verify calibration in the field by checking periodically

tasks.task: Calibrate John Deere type box drill (same general steps as above)
Calibrate air seeder (same general steps as above)
subtasks: Adjust settings specific to John Deere and air seeder models
Measure transmission wheel circumference for John Deere drills
Use catch pan or cups to collect seed samples for John Deere and air seeder calibration
